high_concept: Void-touched mercenaries, occult technicians, and misfit horrors who weaponize stress, overload, and broken physics. Half occult warband, half scrapyard death squad.

setting_types.description: A catalog of environments, dimensions, and zones where PCU goons naturally emerge or operate. Useful for flavor, art direction, and designing new units.

categories.name: Voidspace Fringe
categories.description: Regions where reality folds wrong — gravity breaks, shadows behave strangely, and time dilation produces warped creatures and cultists.

categories.name: Scrapworld Industries
categories.description: Gigantic abandoned industrial zones where rogue machines, engineered beasts, and black-market technomancers flourish.

categories.name: Cultist Enclaves
categories.description: Shadowy settlements where void-priests, demonologists, and possessed goons enact rituals or manufacture horrors.

categories.name: Ooze Marshlands
categories.description: Swamps and wetlands saturated with mutagenic spores and extradimensional runoff, spawning oozes, freaks, and toxic wildlife.

categories.name: The Meat Belt
categories.description: Gross biomechanical regions where living tissue is cultivated like metal ore — a perfect breeding ground for meat constructs and parasitic machines.

categories.name: Temporal Break Zones
categories.description: Areas where time is cracked or nonlinear, home to Shamanic manipulators, Grim-like entities, and beings that punish or disable unwinding.

categories.name: Singularity Events
categories.description: Locations where physics collapses into a single point of terror — birthing overpowering hazards like the Local Singularity.

categories.name: Outer Frontier Settlements
categories.description: Rough frontier towns full of mutants, mercenaries, and half-legal machines — ideal recruitment zones for PCU goons.

tone.description: Names and art should feel like B-movie villains and arcade beat-'em-up enemies: intense, a little goofy, but genuinely dangerous.

silhouette.description: Bold, readable shapes designed for side-scrolling enemies or bosses.
rules: One strong primary shape or weapon defines the unit.
Limbs, weapons, and heads should be clearly readable at small sizes.
Avoid excessive detail; prioritize bold, chunky forms.
Allow bright accents on eyes, cores, runes.

categories.bruisers: Heavy melee enforcers, often mechanical or muscled mutants.
categories.casters: Ritualists or tech-warlocks, often with ranged abilities.
categories.monsters: Slimes, toads, oozes, or strange fauna.
categories.phenomena: Anomalies given form; abstract but coherent silhouettes.

guidelines: Names must be punchy and memorable.
Slightly silly is fine; outright cute is not.
Mix violence, void terminology, and industrial flavor.

special_flags_usage.biological: mutants, natives, freaks, toads, oozes, voidborn.
special_flags_usage.mechanical: bots, constructs, armed chassis, grafted machines.
special_flags_usage.no_unwind: hazards or zealots; always with drawbacks.
